original: Frigell, Martin, kyrkoherde, Kristia-nopel, f. 5/6/82 i Stengårdshult, Jön-köp. 1. G. 3’8 m. Britta Hartwig. Barn: Pontus f. 39, Marita 41, Esbjörn 41 — Stud:ex. i Upps. 04, teol. kand. samt prästv. f. Skara stift 08. Vakanskom-min. i Tådene 09, i Hjälstad 14, i Tidaholm, tf.’ kyrkoh. i Börstig 21, kommin. i Ekby 24, kyrkoh. i Kristianopel sed. 26.
translated: Frigell, Martin, vicar, Kristianopel, born June 5th, 1882 in Stengårdshult, Jönköping. 1st marriage to Britta Hartwig in 1938, with whom he had three children: Pontus born in 1939, Marita born in 1941, and Esbjörn born in 1941. Martin received his B.A. degree from Uppsala in 1904, and then his Bachelor of Theology degree along with his ordination as a priest in Skara diocese in 1908. He served as a temporary minister in Tådene in 1909, in Hjälstad in 1914, in Tidaholm, and as an acting vicar in Börstig in 1921 before becoming a curate in Ekby in 1924. He became the vicar of Kristianopel in 1926 and remained in that position thereafter.
